page.title: 16Farms: Wray, Roeburndale
page.content: Bellhurst, Allcock's and Above Beck are farmed as one farm by the related families living in them. Between the three farms there are 300 acres of land, used for grazing for sheep and cows, and grass for silage and hay. At Allcock's Farm there was a barn full of calves including some Charolais. We saw the dairy and milking unit. We looked at round bales made from the silage. In winter the bales are spread out for the animals to eat. At Bellhurst Farm, built in 1588, water is still pumped from the well by hand. It takes 23 pumps to flush the toilet and 4300 to fill the water tank! Rushes are still collected from the wetland and used for animal bedding.
